Test Procedure: 1. Login as Receptionist/Admin[cite: 2]. 2. Select Patient. 3. Choose valid file (PDF/JPG). 4. [cite_start]Click Upload[cite: 3].
Expected Result: System accepts file. Saves to Patient History. [cite_start]Notifies Doctor[cite: 4].

Test Procedure: 1. Login as Receptionist. 2. Select Patient. 3. Choose invalid file (e.g. .exe). 4. Click Upload.
Expected Result: System validates format. Displays error message. [cite_start]File is not saved[cite: 3].
Comments: Verify loop back to file selection

Test Procedure: 1. Complete valid upload as Receptionist. 2. Login as assigned Doctor. 3. [cite_start]Check Dashboard/Notifications.
Expected Result: Doctor receives notification of new uploaded record[cite: 4].

Test Procedure: 1. Login as Receptionist. 2. Select file. 3. Click Cancel before final submit.
Expected Result: Upload process aborted. No file saved to database.

Test Procedure: 1. [cite_start]Login as Patient[cite: 6]. 2. Navigate to "Patient History".
Expected Result: System displays history in "View Only" mode. [cite_start]No edit options available[cite: 7].

Test Procedure: 1. Login as Doctor. 2. [cite_start]Navigate to "Patient History".
Expected Result: System displays history with options to "Add/Update Notes"[cite: 7].

Test Procedure: 1. Login as Doctor. 2. Access Patient History. 3. Click "Add Note". 4. Enter details and Save.
Expected Result: System saves note to database. [cite_start]Note appears in "Visit Notes" section[cite: 6].

Test Procedure: 1. Login as Doctor. 2. Select existing note. 3. Edit content. 4. Save.
Expected Result: System updates the record. [cite_start]Timestamp reflects modification[cite: 6].

Test Procedure: 1. Login as Patient. 2. [cite_start]Click "View past appointment" in History section.
Expected Result: List of previous appointments displayed correctly[cite: 6].

Test Procedure: 1. Login as Patient. 2. [cite_start]Click "View medication history".
Expected Result: List of prescribed medications displayed correctly[cite: 6].

Test Procedure: 1. Login as a user not linked to the patient (if applicable). 2. Attempt to view history via URL manipulation.
Expected Result: Access Denied. Redirect to error page or dashboard.

Test Procedure: 1. Login as Patient. 2. [cite_start]Navigate to Appointment/Payment section.
Expected Result: System displays correct "Payment Due" amount[cite: 10].

Test Procedure: 1. Select appointment. 2. Choose Payment Method. 3. [cite_start]Enter valid details[cite: 11]. 4. Confirm.
Expected Result: Gateway processes payment. System shows "Success". [cite_start]Receipt generated[cite: 12].

Test Procedure: 1. Initiate payment. 2. Enter card details with insufficient funds/block. 3. Submit.
Expected Result: Gateway returns failure. [cite_start]System shows "Payment was not successful" error[cite: 11].

Test Procedure: 1. Initiate payment. 2. Enter invalid card format (e.g. wrong length). 3. Submit.
Expected Result: System/Gateway validation catches error. Form not submitted.

Test Procedure: 1. Complete successful payment. 2. [cite_start]Check screen or email.
Expected Result: Receipt is displayed/sent to patient[cite: 11].

Test Procedure: 1. Complete successful payment. 2. [cite_start]Check Appointment Status in History.
Expected Result: Status updated to "Paid" or "Confirmed" in database[cite: 12].

Test Procedure: 1. Perform multiple payments. 2. [cite_start]Navigate to "View Payment History"[cite: 10].
Expected Result: All past transactions listed with correct dates and amounts.

Test Procedure: 1. Initiate payment. 2. Simulate network loss/gateway timeout.
Expected Result: System handles gracefully (e.g. "Transaction pending" or "Try again"). No crash.

Test Procedure: 1. Open payment page. 2. Admin manually marks as paid in backend. 3. Patient tries to pay.
Expected Result: System detects status change. Prevents double payment.
